com.wordscounter.model

Class WordsCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wordscounter.model.WordsCounter

  • public class WordsCounter
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class of the program.

    It consists in a command line dialog with the user that lets generate a set of random text files, parse them to calculate the frequency of every word present in it (with single thread and multithread implementations), and review the information of the executions done.

    Author:
    Arekku

        private static void createWorkingFiles()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a set of working files and saves it on disc.

      • askWorkingFilesNumber

        private static int askWorkingFilesNumber()
        Asks the user for the number of working files.
        Returns:
        the number of working files introduced by the user.

        private static int askWorkingFilesSize()
        Asks the user for the size of working files.
        Returns:
        the size of working files introduced by the user.

      • countWordsSingleThread

        private static void countWordsSingleThread()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Counts the frequency of every word present in the set of working files and saves it in a map.

        Implementation note: It parses all the working files, 1 by 1, using a single thread for all of them.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem while trying to read or write a working file.

      • countWordsMultithread

        private static void countWordsMultithread()
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                          java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Counts the frequency of every word present in the set of working files and saves it in a map.

        Implementation note: It parses all the working files, 1 by 1, using a new thread for every file.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem while trying to read or write a working file.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if one of the threads created by this method is interrupted.
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if one of the threads created by this method has an execution error.

      • printExecutionsHistoric

        private static void printExecutionsHistoric()
        Prints the execution information stored in the list of executions.

      • cleanExecutionsHistoric

        private static void cleanExecutionsHistoric()
        Cleans the execution information stored in the list of executions.

      • deleteWorkingFiles

        private static void deleteWorkingFiles()
        Deletes the set of working files from disc.
